Description: Bronze axe-head: it was once thickly corroded but has now been completely cleaned. There is severe pitting all over the blade and both the lugs are damaged, one being almost entirely lost. The cutting edge is also cracked and eroded, though some of this damage is probably due to wear.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (160)
Condition: incomplete - haft and one lug missing
